org.dockbox.selene.api.objects

Class Exceptional<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dockbox.selene.api.objects.Exceptional<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type parameter

    public final class Exceptional<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A container object which may or may not contain a non-null value. If a value is present, isPresent() will return true and get() will return the value. If no value is present, isAbsent() will return false.

    Additional methods that depend on the presence or absence of a contained value are provided, such as orElse() (return a default value if value not present) and ifPresent() (execute a block of code if the value is present).

    This is a extended type of Optional, providing additional support for Exception checks and actions. Additionally it allows for more abilities to construct the type from a Callable, Optional and to create from a Throwable instance.

      • of

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> of(java.util.Optional<T> optional)
        Provides a Exceptional instance based on a provided Optional instance. If the optional contains a value, it is unwrapped and rewrapped in of(Object). If the optional doesn't contain a value, empty() is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the potential value
        Parameters:
        optional - The Optional instance to rewrap
        Returns:
        The Exceptional

      • of

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> of(T value)
        Provides a Exceptional instance which contains a non-null value of type T. This requires the provided value to be non-null. If the value is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value provided
        Parameters:
        value - The value to wrap
        Returns:
        The Exceptional
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - When the provided value is null

      • empty

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> empty()
        Provides a Exceptional instance which contains no value and no throwable. The returned instance is a cast copy of EMPTY
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the value which the instance is cast to
        Returns:
        The empty Exceptional

      • of

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> of(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> supplier)
        Provides a Exceptional instance based on a provided Callable. If the supplier throws any type of Throwable of(Throwable) is returned, describing the thrown throwable. If the supplier successfully provided a value, ofNullable(Object) is returned. This also means suppliers can return nullable values.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the potential value
        Parameters:
        supplier - The Callable instance, supplying the value
        Returns:
        The Exceptional

      • ofNullable

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> ofNullable(T value)
        Provides a Exceptional instance which can contain a value in value. The value can be null. If the value is null, empty() is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the potential value
        Parameters:
        value - The potential value to wrap
        Returns:
        The Exceptional

      • of

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> of(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Provides a Exceptional instance which contains no value, but contains the given throwable as throwable. This requires the provided throwable to be non-null. If the throwable is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the absent value
        Parameters:
        throwable - The throwable to wrap
        Returns:
        The Exceptional
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - When the provided value is null

        public T get()

        Returns:
        the non-null value held by this Optional

      • map

        public <U> Exceptional<U> map(java.util.function.Function<? super T,? extends U> mapper)
        If a value is present, apply the provided mapping function to it, and if the result is non-null, return an Exceptional describing the result. Otherwise return empty(). 
        
 Exceptional<TextChannel> textChannel = JDAUtils.getJDA()
 .map(jda -> jda.getTextChannelById(channelId));

        Here, getJDA returns an Exceptional<JDA>, and then map returns an Exceptional<TextChannel> for the desired channel if one exists.

        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the result of the mapping function
        Parameters:
        mapper - A mapping function to apply to the value, if present
        Returns:
        an Exceptional describing the result of applying a mapping function to the value of this Exceptional, if a value is present, otherwise an empty Optional
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the mapping function is null

      • errorPresent

        public boolean errorPresent()
        Return true if there is a throwable present, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if there is a throwable present, otherwise false

      • ofNullable

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> ofNullable(T value,
                                            java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Provides a Exceptional instance which can contain both a value in value and a throwable in throwable. Both the value and throwable can be null.
        • If the value is null and the throwable is not null, of(Throwable) is used to generate the instance.
        • If the value is not null and the throwable is null, of(Object) is used to generate the instance.
        • If both the value and the throwable are null, empty() is used to generate the new instance.
        • If neither the value and the throwable are null, of(Object, Throwable) is used to generate the new instance.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the potential value
        Parameters:
        value - The potential value to wrap
        throwable - The potential throwable to wrap
        Returns:
        The Exceptional

      • of

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> of(T value,
                                    java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Provides a Exceptional instance which contains both a value in value and a throwable in throwable. This requires both the value and the throwable to be non-null. If either is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the absent value
        Parameters:
        value - The value to wrap
        throwable - The throwable to wrap
        Returns:
        The Exceptional
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - When the provided value is null

      • flatMap

        public <U> Exceptional<U> flatMap(java.util.function.Function<? super T,Exceptional<U>> mapper)
        If a value is present, apply the provided Exceptional-bearing mapping function to it, return that result, otherwise return empty(). This method is similar to map(Function), but the provided mapper is one whose result is already an Exceptional, and if invoked, flatMap does not wrap it with an additional Exceptional.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type parameter to the Exceptional returned
        Parameters:
        mapper - A mapping function to apply to the value, if present
        Returns:
        The result of applying an Exceptional-bearing mapping function to the value of this Exceptional, if a value is present, otherwise empty()
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the mapping function is null or returns a null result

      • flatMap

        public <U> Exceptional<U> flatMap(java.util.function.BiFunction<? super T,java.lang.Throwable,Exceptional<U>> mapper)
        If a value is present, apply the provided Exceptional-bearing mapping function to both the value and throwable described by this Exceptional, return that result, otherwise return empty(). This method is similar to flatMap(Function), but the provided mapper is one whose input is both a Throwable and a value of type T.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type parameter to the Exceptional returned
        Parameters:
        mapper - A mapping function to apply to the value and throwable, if present
        Returns:
        The result of applying an Exceptional-bearing mapping function to the value and throwable of this Exceptional, if a value is present, otherwise empty()
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the mapping function is null or returns a null result

      • rethrow

        public Exceptional<T> rethrow()
                       throws CheckedSeleneException
        If a throwable is present, wrap it in a new CheckedSeleneException and throw the wrapped exception, otherwise do nothing.
        Returns:
        The Exceptional, for chaining
        Throws:
        CheckedSeleneException - If throwable is not null and is rethrown

        Returns:
        The Exceptional, for chaining
        Throws:
        UncheckedSeleneException - If throwable is not null and is rethrown

      • orElseSupply

        public Exceptional<T> orElseSupply(java.util.function.Supplier<T> defaultValue)
        Return a Exceptional instance holding the value if present, otherwise invoke defaultValue and return the result of that invocation, combined with a throwable if a throwable is present. This method is similar to orElseGet(Supplier), but instead of returning the value, the result is wrapped in a Exceptional.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - A Supplier whose result is wrapped if no value is present
        Returns:
        The Exceptional, for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If a value is present and defaultValue is null

      • isAbsent

        public boolean isAbsent()
        Return true if there is no value present, otherwise false. Acts as a inverse of isPresent().
        Returns:
        true if there is no value present, otherwise false

      • getType

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Class<?> getType()
        Returns the type of the value, if it is present. Otherwise returns null.
        Returns:
        The type of the value, or null
